verses.text_plain: And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.
verses.verse_html: 1And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.

verses.text_plain: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
verses.verse_html: 2And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

verses.text_plain: Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
verses.verse_html: 3Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

verses.text_plain: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
verses.verse_html: 4I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

verses.text_plain: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
verses.verse_html: 5As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

verses.text_plain: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
verses.verse_html: 6When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,

verses.text_plain: And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.
verses.verse_html: 7And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

verses.text_plain: The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
verses.verse_html: 8The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?

verses.text_plain: Some said, This is he: others said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.
verses.verse_html: 9Some said, This is he: others said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.

verses.text_plain: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
verses.verse_html: 10Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?

verses.text_plain: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.
verses.verse_html: 11He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.

verses.text_plain: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
verses.verse_html: 12Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

verses.text_plain: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
verses.verse_html: 13They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

verses.text_plain: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
verses.verse_html: 14And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

verses.text_plain: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
verses.verse_html: 15Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.

verses.text_plain: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
verses.verse_html: 16Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.

verses.text_plain: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
verses.verse_html: 17They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.

verses.text_plain: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
verses.verse_html: 18But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.

verses.text_plain: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
verses.verse_html: 19And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?

verses.text_plain: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:
verses.verse_html: 20His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

verses.text_plain: But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.
verses.verse_html: 21But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.

verses.text_plain: These words spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
verses.verse_html: 22These words spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

verses.text_plain: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.
verses.verse_html: 23Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

verses.text_plain: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
verses.verse_html: 24Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.

verses.text_plain: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.
verses.verse_html: 25He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

verses.text_plain: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
verses.verse_html: 26Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

verses.text_plain: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear it again? will ye also be his disciples?
verses.verse_html: 27He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear it again? will ye also be his disciples?

verses.text_plain: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses’ disciples.
verses.verse_html: 28Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses’ disciples.

verses.text_plain: We know that God spake unto Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.
verses.verse_html: 29We know that God spake unto Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.

verses.text_plain: The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
verses.verse_html: 30The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.

verses.text_plain: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
verses.verse_html: 31Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.

verses.text_plain: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
verses.verse_html: 32Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

verses.text_plain: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
verses.verse_html: 33If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

verses.text_plain: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
verses.verse_html: 34They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

verses.text_plain: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
verses.verse_html: 35Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?

verses.text_plain: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
verses.verse_html: 36He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?

verses.text_plain: And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.
verses.verse_html: 37And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
verses.verse_html: 38And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

verses.text_plain: And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.
verses.verse_html: 39And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

verses.text_plain: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?
verses.verse_html: 40And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?

verses.text_plain: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
verses.verse_html: 41Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
